error.signature: ERROR: No matching distribution found for package

verdict.summary: No wheel or sdist matches your Python version, OS, or architecture. Common with native extensions.

dead_ends.why_fails: If no source distribution exists either, build will fail with missing C headers
Rarely the issue â€” usually a platform or Python version mismatch

workarounds.action: Check if the package supports your Python version and platform
workarounds.how:
python --version  # check your Python version
pip debug --verbose  # shows compatible tags
# Visit https://pypi.org/project/PACKAGE/#files to see available wheels

workarounds.action: Use a different Python version that the package supports
workarounds.how:
pyenv install 3.11.8
pyenv local 3.11.8
python -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate
pip install package-name

workarounds.action: Specify --platform and --python-version flags if building for a different target

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'No matching distribution' means the package exists but no compatible wheel is available, while 'Could not find a version' means no version satisfies the constraint.
